lines.content: * Represents a command to add a task to the task list.
* Constructs an AddCommand with the specified task.
* @param task The task to be added to the task list.
* Executes the add command by adding the specified task to the task list.
* @param tasks   The task list containing the tasks.
* @param ui      The UI instance for displaying messages.
* @param storage The storage handler for saving task updates (not used here).
* @return False, as this command does not terminate the application.
* @throws TaskmaxException If an error occurs while adding the task.
public boolean execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws TaskmaxException {
ui.showMessage("Got it. I've added this task:\n  "
+ "\nNow you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");
* Represents an abstract command in the Taskmax application.
* All commands must implement the execute method to perform specific actions.
* Executes the command with the given task list, UI, and storage.
* @param tasks   The task list containing the tasks.
* @param ui      The UI instance for displaying messages.
* @param storage The storage handler for saving or loading tasks.
* @return A boolean indicating whether the command requires the application to terminate.
* @throws TaskmaxException If an error occurs while executing the command.
public abstract boolean execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws TaskmaxException;
* Represents a command to delete a task from the task list.
* Constructs a DeleteCommand with the given task index.
* @param index The one-based index of the task to be deleted.
this.index = index - 1; // Convert one-based index to zero-based index.

public boolean execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws TaskmaxException {
+ "\nNow you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");
* Represents a command to exit the application and save tasks.

ui.showMessage("Tasks have been saved to my drive!");

* Represents a command to find tasks matching a given keyword in the task list.

* Represents a command to list all tasks in the task list.

* Validates that the user input contains the expected number of parts.

* Returns the help message when an invalid command is entered.
return Ui.LINE + "Hey there! There are 8 things I can help you with! \n"
+ "\n1. List: Enter \"list\" and I will list out all the tasks you have given me!\n"
+ "2. Todo: Enter \"todo theTaskName\" to add a task you plan to do!\n"
+ "3. Deadlines: Enter \"deadline theTaskName /by yyyy-mm-dd 24hrTime\" to add a task with a specific deadline!\n"
+ "4. Events: Enter \"event theTaskName /from yyyy-mm-dd 24hrTime /to yyyy-mm-dd 24hrTime\" to add an event!\n"
+ "5. Delete: Enter \"delete theTaskListNumber\" to delete a task from the list!\n"
+ "6. Mark as done: Enter \"mark TaskListNumber\" to mark the task as complete in the list!\n"
+ "7. Mark as undone: Enter \"unmark TaskListNumber\" to mark the task as incomplete in the list!\n"
+ "8. Find: Enter \"find Word(s)YouWantToFind\" to find tasks that match the keyword in the description.\n"
+ "\nIf you need a refresher, just enter any word!"
+ "\nIf you are satisfied with your service, enter \"bye\" to save your task list and exit!\n"
+ "\nDo remember that my input receptors are sensitive so please be careful with your spelling"
+ "\nThat is all and happy scheduling! ~Taskmax :D\n" + Ui.LINE;
